newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money up on repo rate rise, devaluation.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money up on repo rate rise, devaluation.

text.p: Pakistan's inter-bank money market rates jumped on Tuesday after the central bank devalued the rupee by 7.86 percent against the dollar and raised repo discount rate by 3.0 percent, dealers said.

"The market was on fire because of the twin below of the rupee devaluation and rise in discount rate," an official of Standard Chartered Bank said. "The market was short and borrowers were scrambling for funds."
The repo rates rose drastically, a dealer at KASB & Co said. "Three-month trading, which was seen at 15 percent yesterday, crossed the 17 percent level today." -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
